frame.name: Misdeed
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Wrongdoer</fen> engages in a <fen>Misdeed</fen>.
<ex><fex name="wro">You</fex> have <t>sinned</t> for the last time, Stephen!</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Wrongdoer
FE.definition: <def-root>This is the person whose <fen>Misdeed</fen> is being judged with respect to its morality. </def-root>

FE.name: Misdeed
FE.definition:
<def-root>The assessment of the <fen>Wrongdoer</fen> is based on his or her <fen>Misdeed</fen>.
</def-root>

FE.name: Severity
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Severity</fen> is the degree to which the <fen>Misdeed</fen> offends the moral sense of the <fen>Viewpoint</fen>.
<ex>Such a <fex name="sev">grievous</fex> <t>sin</t> was not likely to go unpunished.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Viewpoint
FE.definition: <def-root>The individual whose point of view is taken in assigning the judgment denoted by the target. </def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The time at which a <fen>Misdeed</fen> is performed.
<ex>The <t>misdeeds</t> <fex name="tim">of the previous evening</fex> were all forgotten now.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The location where a <fen>Misdeed</fen> occurs.
<ex>Sexual <t>peccadilloes</t> <fex name="Place">in the White House</fex> are one thing, lying before Congress quite another.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition:
<def-root>The state-of-affairs that the <fen>Wrongdoer</fen> is hoping to accomplish through their <fen>Misdeed</fen>.
<ex>You <t>sin</t> merely <fex name="pur">to spit in the eye of your own creator</fex>!</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition:
<def-root>An action taken by the <fen>Wrongdoer</fen> which accomplishes the <fen>Misdeed</fen>.
<ex>If they <t>sin</t> <fex name="mea">by ignoring the warnings of their elders</fex>, they are to blame for the consequences.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the <fen>Misdeed</fen> which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly</ment>, <ment>loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of a <fen>Wrongdoer</fen> that also affect the action (<ment>presumptuously</ment>, <ment>coldly</ment>, <ment>deliberately</ment>, <ment>eagerly</ment>, <ment>carefully</ment>).
<ex>Many years of <fex name="man">quiet</fex> <t>transgressions</t> later, he found he no longer knew if it was truly wrong.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Injured_party
FE.definition:
<def-root>An individual who is harmed by the <fen>Misdeed</fen> of the <fen>Wrongdoer</fen>.
<ex><t>Sins</t> <fex name="inj">against one's fellow man</fex> are the most egregious, though.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: vergrijp.n
lexUnit.definition: waarmee men zich niet aan de regels of aan de wet houdt
